Hi @lolyu does dualtor need this test? It would affect source IP sent from relay to DHCP server

> Hi @lolyu does dualtor need this test? It would affect source IP sent from relay to DHCP server

If it is a generic feature on T0, dualtor will need it.
dhcp-relay will enable source port ip on t0, right?

> > Hi @lolyu does dualtor need this test? It would affect source IP sent from relay to DHCP server
> 
> If it is a generic feature on T0, dualtor will need it. dhcp-relay will enable source port ip on t0, right?

@lolyu What do you mean by 'dhcp-relay will enable source port ip on t0'?

From my understanding and research, 
when the -si is used, in the relay packets, the source ip will be client_ip instead of the loopback ip of DUT.

In the buildimage, only when deployment_id==8, we enable source ip in relay.
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/blob/e0e0c0c1b3c58635bc25fde6a77ca3b0849dfde1/dockers/docker-dhcp-relay/dhcpv4-relay.agents.j2#L16
But not sure when the deployment_id will be 8 in the production ENV.

> > Hi @lolyu does dualtor need this test? It would affect source IP sent from relay to DHCP server
> 
> If it is a generic feature on T0, dualtor will need it. dhcp-relay will enable source port ip on t0, right?

@lolyu If -si is not set, kernel would set source IP of relayed packets automatically. If -si is set, dhcrelay would force to set source IP of relayed packets to be the egress interface ip. The client and server ports wouldn't be changed

202205 telemetry is working because it's already using the mechanism of bypassing client auth by calling fixture setup_streaming_telemetry. In 2405 there are more new test cases added which does not add setup_streaming_telemetry. This will make test case fail if run those new case. 
Remember setup_streaming_telemetry is with scope module so it's only called once when running telemetry tests together. We still need this for each test case in case we need to run single test.

@zbud-msft There are 2 solutions for this. 
1) As this PR is currently doing now. Cons: Need to add setup_streaming_telemetry to every test function which needs GNMI access. 
2) Set setup_streaming_telemetry with autouse=true. In this case, any test case been run will automatically trigger setup_streaming_telemetry. Cons: Some test function not using GNMI will also have fixture setup_streaming_telemetry triggered. For example: test_config_db_parameters and test_telemetry_enabledbydefault if you run only those test functions. 

Please let me know your opinion on this. I can do either way you prefer.

The verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts is defined in helper files of PFC testcases for both single ASIC and multidut scenario. 

The verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts is defined in tests/common/snappi_tests/traffic_generation.py is ONLY one calling get_lossless_buffer_size.

get_lossless_buffer_size is using config_facts to determine the buffer-size.
```
config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=host_ans.hostname,
 source="running")['ansible_facts']
```
However, if it is multi-asic platform, the config_facts will not return ingress_lossless profile as it is stored in config_facts as nested dictionary with asic as one of the key.

```
config_facts = host_ans.config_facts(host=duthost1.hostname,
 source="running", namespace=asic_value)['ansible_facts']
```

Proposed solution:
Change needs to be in multidut PFC testcase helper files to send right asic value to verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts(which has default asic_value set to NONE). If asic_value is passed to verify_in_flight_buffer_pkts, it will call get_lossless_buffer_size (which has default asic_value also set to NONE) with right asic_value.

Will discuss this in the community before making the changes.

Thanks,
-A
